text.p: Here are highlights of stories in Romania's press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy:
Business:
ROMANIA LIBERA
- Romania recovered over $30 million from Iran's outstanding debt in crude and fuel oil imports.

- New Communications Minister Sorin Pantis said national telephone operator Romtelecom RA should be privatised. Experts in the telecommunications sector say in Romania's current situation the best solution would be to sell a minority stake in the company.
- Romania's Trade Ministry approved exports of 500,000 tonnes of maize in the first half of 1997.
ADEVARUL

- Electricity prices should go up as Romania produces electricity at $42 per megawatt and sells it at $38, Victor Romert, president of Renel RA electricity authority told a news conference on Thursday.
- International Monetary Fund chief negotiator for Romania Poul Thomsen praised the economic programme of Prime Minister Victor Ciorbea.
- Former U.S. Secretary of State James Baker said during a meeting in the United States with 50 Romanian companies that the country was an attractive market for American firms.
TINERETUL LIBER
- The price of electricity and thermal power is expected to rise by 35 percent.
AZI
- Societe Generale and Banca Franco-Romana opened letters of credit of $28.5 million and $10.5 million respectively to finance crude oil imports on guarantees from oil importer Petrolexportimport SA.
- Ciorbea will withdraw from parliament a draft 1997 budget worked out by the former government.
LIBERTATEA
- Turbomecanica SA aircraft engine maker and Petromin SA shipping company are among the heaviest traded stocks on the over-the-counter market.
General
ROMANIA LIBERA
- The newspaper publishes Prime Minister Ciorbea's speech in parliament before winning a confidence vote for his cabinet and programme.
ADEVARUL

- The Party of Social Democracy (PDSR) will undergo changes and is likely to be headed by a single leader, probably former President Ion Iliescu, said Adrian Nastase, currently PDSR executive chairman.
EVENIMENTUL ZILEI
- The newspaper publishes excerpts from the monthly magazine "Files of History" presenting drawings allegedly made by dictator Nicolae Ceausescu during communist party meetings.
- Romania's liberal parties are likely to merge at a conference early next year, said Mircea Ionescu Quintus, head of the National Liberal Party.
ZIUA
- The PDSR will hold its national conference on January 10.
CRONICA ROMANA
- The parliament starts debates on the new traffic code which sets the speed limit in towns at 50 km per hour, down from the present 60.
- The Social Democratic Union, member in the centrist governing coalition, wants 12 posts of prefects and 23 of state secretaries. ($=3,732 lei) -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
